step1.sentence: After months of trial and error, the research team finally felt they were on the right track.

step2.story: Maria had been struggling with her business plan for weeks. When her mentor reviewed her latest draft and said she was on the right track, she finally felt a wave of relief. That small encouragement gave her the confidence to keep pushing forward.

step3.story: James had spent three years bouncing between jobs, never quite feeling like he belonged anywhere. After landing an internship at a tech startup, he discovered a genuine passion for product design. His manager pulled him aside one afternoon and told him he was on the right track — that his instincts were sharp and his work was already making an impact. For the first time, James felt a deep sense of direction and purpose. He threw himself into every project with renewed energy, certain that this was exactly where he was meant to be.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 올바른 궤도(철도 선로) 위에 있다는 뜻으로, 목표를 향해 올바른 방향으로 나아가고 있음을 의미한다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 누군가의 노력이나 진행 방향이 맞다고 확인해 줄 때 사용한다. '잘 하고 있어', '제대로 가고 있어'라는 격려와 확신의 표현으로 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 철도가 발달하던 19세기에 기원한 표현으로, 열차가 올바른 선로(track) 위에 있어야 목적지에 도달한다는 개념에서 유래했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 시행착오 끝에 올바른 방향을 찾았음을 확인할 때 특히 잘 어울린다. 단순한 칭찬보다 '방향이 맞다'는 확신과 안도의 뉘앙스가 강하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Keep going — you're on the right track.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 계속해 — 넌 올바른 방향으로 가고 있어.
